intro: Beilschmiedia mayumbensis, commonly known as the Mayumbé beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America, particularly in regions of Ecuador and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its fruit is a small, smooth, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed. Beilschmiedia mayumbensis plays a role in its ecosystem as a food source for various wildlife species and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
